text:
Hi, I'm Jake Burns, Enterprise
Strategist with AWS.

With a seat at the C-suite
table, most marketers are in a

position to lead key strategic
conversations.

Chief marketing officers
(CMOs) reported that they often

lead C-suite conversations
about customer experience
and digital transformation.

The CMO usually has overall
business and marketing

responsibilities
while building the functional

expertise directly into the core
marketing teams whenever
possible.

The CMO is often the chief
strategist and orchestrator

of the integrated go-to-market
plan.

The CMO role is evolving
as digital experiences
and marketing have evolved.

Leading teams across marketing
strategy, marketing operations,

and even marketing technology
stacks can make it challenging

for CMOs to tie all the pieces
together to drive the business

to the next level of digital
transformation.

Breaking down silos in organizations
is key to successfully

raising the bar of customer
experiences through digital
transformation.

CMOs need to learn what is happening
across their companyâ€™s

entire technology stack to find
new ways to collaborate

with others as they prepare
for a new era of digital
transformation.

Maximizing the opportunities
created by digital transformation

means CMOs must understand,
in detail, the day-to-day
challenges facing teams.

These challenges might include
cloud infrastructure,
security, DevOps, data and insight.

Understanding these challenges
helps ensure that no team involved

in digital transformation
works in isolation.

Some common areas where we see
marketers asking for our help

are with omnichannel
analytics, customer-engagement

metrics, and opportunities
to automate the customer
journey.

AWS can help CMOs in these
areas by using unmatched

analytics and machine learning
(ML) capabilities.

They can also use the breadth
and depth of pre-trained

ML capabilities, the largest
partner network of any cloud

provider, and the Amazon marketing
system.
